did.repository: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

bioghist.p: George Allan Dash, Jr. (1908-2000) was an arbitrator who worked on labor arbitration cases for the American Arbitration Association, the Federal Mediation and Conciliation Service, and the New Jersey State Board of Mediation. He also served on the US Wage Stabilization Board and the US Emergency Board (convened in 1961 to arbitrate a dispute between Pan-Am and the Flight Engineers International Association).

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of decisions and awards from cases heard by G. Allan Dash, Jr., arbitrator. The materials date from 1939 to 1970 and cover labor-management disputes in a wide variety of companies and industries. Companies for whom Dash decided multiple cases include: Honeywell, Goodyear Tire and Rubber Co., U.S. Rubber Co., Bendix, and General Motors. The collection also includes a small number of printed agreements for a variety of cases and companies.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
